title: Masculine Plurals (-os -> -oi).
reading_greek: Ο κύριος είναι εδώ. Οι κύριοι είναι στο σπίτι. Ο φίλος μου είναι ψηλός. Οι φίλοι μου είναι δυνατοί. Ο πατέρας είναι καλός.
reading_english: The gentleman is here. The gentlemen are at home. My friend is tall. My friends are strong. The father is good.
audio_script: Welcome to Week 4 of your Greek course. ... Today, we are learning about masculine plurals. ...  A common and very important pattern for masculine nouns ending in '-os' in the singular, is changing that '-os' to '-oi' in the plural. ...  This changes 'o' (the singular 'the') to 'oi' (the plural 'the'). ...  So 'o kyrios' (the gentleman) becomes 'oi kyrioi' (the gentlemen). ... Now, listen to a short reading passage demonstrating this concept. ... Ο κύριος είναι εδώ. Οι κύριοι είναι στο σπίτι. Ο φίλος μου είναι ψηλός. Οι φίλοι μου είναι δυνατοί. Ο πατέρας είναι καλός. ...  Let's break down the key examples. ... 'Ο φίλος' means 'the friend.' ... 'Οι φίλοι' means 'the friends.' ... Notice how the '-os' changes to '-oi'. ... Now, repeat the plural forms after me: ... 'Οι κύριοι.' ... 'Οι φίλοι.' ... Great job. Remember to practice this essential plural pattern.
